        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 5 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree at a price she can resell for a profit. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering 2 coins per kilogram and Lennon countering with 2.5 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.

          Plan: [08:00 - 09:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for a price of 2 coins per kilogram or less. [09:00 - 10:00] Purchase as much fruit as possible at the negotiated price, ensuring quality and freshness. [10:00 - 11:00] Securely pack the purchased fruit in her wagon, protecting it from damage during transport. [11:00 - 12:00] Depart Fruitville, heading towards her home town.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (b)
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00]
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she experienced her first taste of injustice. A boy in her village, Thomas, took credit for a doll she had made, boasting about its intricate embroidery to the other children. Della seethed with anger, vowing to never again allow anyone to steal her due credit.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she discovered a talent for bartering. At the local market, she traded a handful of wild berries for a prized ribbon, convincing the vendor it was worth far more than its meager value. The thrill of outsmarting the shopkeeper ignited a spark within her, a sense of power that she craved.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she witnessed her father, a struggling farmer, cheated out of a fair price for his harvest by a shrewd merchant. The injustice burned within her, fueling her resentment towards those who exploited the vulnerable. That day, she swore to never be taken advantage of again.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she began helping her father at the market, selling their meager produce. She quickly learned to haggle, her sharp tongue and calculating gaze intimidating even the most seasoned buyers. Della relished the power she held, the ability to extract every last copper coin.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she struck out on her own, purchasing a rickety wagon and a small stock of fruit. She traveled from town to town, her sharp eyes assessing the quality of produce and her tongue as sharp as her knife when negotiating prices. Each successful sale fueled her ambition, her desire to amass a fortune and prove her worth to the world.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she encountered a travelling merchant who tried to undercut her prices, stealing her customers with promises of lower costs. Della fought back, spreading rumors about the man's dishonest practices and refusing to lower her own prices. She emerged victorious, her reputation for fairness and quality solidified.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is an ambitious and cunning businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer

        • Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins per kilogram or reject it and continue negotiating.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they wandered away from their family's stall at the market, drawn by the vibrant colors and exotic scents of a spice merchant's wares. The merchant, a jovial man with a booming laugh, let Lennon sample fragrant cinnamon and fiery chili peppers, sparking a lifelong fascination with the unknown.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they overheard their parents arguing about the dwindling profits of their fruit stall. That night, Lennon stayed awake, meticulously planning new routes and strategies to attract customers, their mind buzzing with ideas for expansion.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they bartered a prized possession – a hand-carved wooden bird – for a sack of unfamiliar, jewel-toned fruits from a travelling merchant. The gamble paid off; the fruits were a sensation at the market, and Lennon tasted the thrill of a successful deal for the first time.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they convinced their parents to let them travel to a neighboring town to sell fruit on their own. The journey was fraught with challenges – a broken wagon wheel, a sudden storm, and a near-miss with bandits – but Lennon persevered, returning home with a newfound confidence and a pocket full of coins.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they fell deeply in love with a young woman who shared their passion for adventure. But their nomadic lifestyle proved incompatible with her desire for stability, and the heartbreak left Lennon with a deep-seated fear of intimacy.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they embarked on a perilous journey across treacherous mountains to secure a rare and valuable fruit. The journey tested their resilience and resourcefulness, solidifying their belief that risk and reward went hand in hand.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market and is negotiating a price of 2.5 coins per kilogram, as Della has offered 2 coins.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price. Della has offered 2 coins per kilogram, but Lennon wants 2.5 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins per kilogram or reject it and continue negotiating.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to counter-offer with a price closer to their desired 2.5 coins per kilogram.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-12 00:10:00.


          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price. Della has offered 2 coins per kilogram, but Lennon wants 2.5 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins per kilogram or reject it and continue negotiating.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to counter-offer with a price closer to their desired 2.5 coins per kilogram.
          Time
        • 1895-09-12 00:10:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Lennon Figtree: 0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '5 coins', 'Lennon Figtree': 'reject'}

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is an ambitious and cunning businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman who is determined to succeed.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a travelling fruit merchant.
          feeling about recent progress in life: determined and ambitious, likely feeling satisfied with her progress in building a successful business.
          core characteristics: a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman who is determined to succeed. She is known for her sharp negotiating skills and her unwillingness to be taken advantage of. Della is also fiercely independent and driven by a desire to prove her worth to the world.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [08:00 - 09:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for a price of 2 coins per kilogram or less. [09:00 - 10:00] Purchase as much fruit as possible at the negotiated price, ensuring quality and freshness. [10:00 - 11:00] Securely pack the purchased fruit in her wagon, protecting it from damage during transport. [11:00 - 12:00] Depart Fruitville, heading towards her home town.

She traveled from town to town, her sharp eyes assessing the quality of produce and her tongue as sharp as her knife when negotiating prices. Each successful sale fueled her ambition, her desire to amass a fortune and prove her worth to the world.

        • Act
          Value
        • 3 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a merchant who travels to different towns to buy and sell goods. She is currently trying to negotiate a price for some apples with Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is an ambitious and cunning businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman who is determined to succeed.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.

          Plan: [08:00 - 09:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for a price of 2 coins per kilogram or less. [09:00 - 10:00] Purchase as much fruit as possible at the negotiated price, ensuring quality and freshness. [10:00 - 11:00] Securely pack the purchased fruit in her wagon, protecting it from damage during transport. [11:00 - 12:00] Depart Fruitville, heading towards her home town.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (c)
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is an ambitious and cunning businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman who is determined to succeed.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 3 coins per kilogram of apples or reject the offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he watched in horror as a sudden hailstorm battered his mother’s carefully arranged fruit display, bruising peaches and splitting open melons. He helped his mother gather the salvaged fruit, his small hands working tirelessly to minimize their loss. That night, huddled in their wagon, Cedric vowed to himself that he would learn everything he could about protecting their precious cargo from the whims of nature.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he convinced his mother to let him handle a particularly difficult customer, a gruff man who haggled relentlessly over the price of a basket of plums. Cedric, with a disarming smile and a firm but fair demeanor, managed to strike a deal that left both parties satisfied. From that day forward, Cedric’s mother trusted him to handle increasingly complex negotiations.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his mother on a journey through a treacherous mountain pass. A landslide blocked their path, stranding them for days with dwindling supplies. Cedric, drawing on his knowledge of foraging, managed to find edible berries and roots, ensuring their survival until the path was cleared.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he took his first solo trip to a distant market, his wagon laden with his mother’s finest apples. Despite encountering unexpected challenges along the way, including a flat tire and a sudden downpour, Cedric persevered, relying on his resourcefulness and determination to reach his destination.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he faced his first major setback when a band of bandits raided his wagon, stealing most of his fruit and leaving him with only a few bruised pears. Though heartbroken, Cedric refused to give up. He used the remaining pears to bake and sell pastries, earning enough money to restock his wagon and continue his journey.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he decided to expand his business, investing in a larger wagon and hiring a young apprentice. He taught the apprentice everything he knew about selecting, transporting, and selling fruit, sharing his passion and his commitment to honesty and fairness.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 3 coins for the apples, but Cedric was hoping for 2.5 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 3 coins per kilogram of apples or reject the offer.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:10:00.


          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 3 coins for the apples, but Cedric was hoping for 2.5 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 3 coins per kilogram of apples or reject the offer.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.
          Time
        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 3.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 2.0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '3 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 1 coin

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they convinced their parents to let them travel to a neighboring town to sell fruit on their own. The journey was fraught with challenges – a broken wagon wheel, a sudden storm, and a near-miss with bandits – but Lennon persevered, returning home with a newfound confidence and a pocket full of coins.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they fell deeply in love with a young woman who shared their passion for adventure. But their nomadic lifestyle proved incompatible with her desire for stability, and the heartbreak left Lennon with a deep-seated fear of intimacy.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they embarked on a perilous journey across treacherous mountains to secure a rare and valuable fruit. The journey tested their resilience and resourcefulness, solidifying their belief that risk and reward went hand in hand.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, you know, the sweetest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine peaches, no doubt, but I need to make a profit too.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches that allows her to make a profit while still being acceptable to Cedric.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 3 coins
          Answer: (a)

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, you know, the sweetest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine peaches, no doubt, but I need to make a profit too.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a price that will allow her to make a profit when she sells them back home.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine peaches, no doubt, but I need to make a profit too.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, you know, the sweetest in all of Fruitville.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches that allows her to make a profit while still being acceptable to Cedric.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric can either accept the offer of 1 coin from Lennon Figtree or reject it.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he faced his first major setback when a band of bandits raided his wagon, stealing most of his fruit and leaving him with only a few bruised pears. Though heartbroken, Cedric refused to give up. He used the remaining pears to bake and sell pastries, earning enough money to restock his wagon and continue his journey.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he decided to expand his business, investing in a larger wagon and hiring a young apprentice. He taught the apprentice everything he knew about selecting, transporting, and selling fruit, sharing his passion and his commitment to honesty and fairness.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm willing to buy a good amount, but I can't go any higher than 2 coins a kilogram. That's all I can afford to make a profit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but two coins barely covers my costs. How about we settle on 2.5 coins? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, you know, the sweetest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine peaches, no doubt, but I need to make a profit too.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a merchant in Fruitville who successfully sold some fruit to Della Plumstone and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree for more fruit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, you know, the sweetest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric can either accept the offer of 1 coin from Lennon Figtree or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject the offer of 1 coin.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:10:00

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • Lennon Figtree observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

      Cedric Meadowbrook: 0

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 1 coin

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone is a determined and resourceful businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, with all due respect, these are the finest apples in the market. You know my fruit is always top quality. Surely, 2.5 coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman who is determined to succeed.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, you know, the sweetest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine peaches, no doubt, but I need to make a profit too.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, your peaches are lovely, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about 2 coins a kilogram? That's a fair price, and I'm sure your customers will love these peaches.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a travelling fruit merchant.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling optimistic and empowered given her recent successes in business.
          core characteristics: a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman who is driven by a desire to succeed and amass a fortune. She is known for her sharp negotiating skills and her ability to get the best possible price for herself, even if it means being tough and uncompromising. Her experiences with injustice in her youth have fueled her determination to never be taken advantage of again.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a determined and resourceful businesswoman.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [08:00 - 09:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming for a price of 2 coins per kilogram or less. [09:00 - 10:00] Purchase as much fruit as possible at the negotiated price, ensuring quality and freshness. [10:00 - 11:00] Securely pack the purchased fruit in her wagon, protecting it from damage during transport. [11:00 - 12:00] Depart Fruitville, heading towards her home town.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your apples, but 2.5 coins is more than I can afford. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for herself.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, you know, the sweetest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine peaches, no doubt, but I need to make a profit too.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose.           [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, your peaches are lovely, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about 2 coins a kilogram? That's a fair price, and I'm sure your customers will love these peaches.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree at a good price so she can resell them for a profit. They are currently negotiating the price, with Della wanting a lower price than Lennon's initial offer.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.
